title: Nate: From Uncertainty to Certainty via Great Books, Culinary Arts and Re-Enchantment
description:
Nate and I intend to talk about Barfield's participation and re-enchantment via an analysis of a recent twitter thread about postmodernism, and before we get there, I hear Nate's life story. So this will be Part 1 of our project and Part 2 will get into the twitter thread in depth, discussing "manifesting", social construction, metaphysics of discourse, postmodernism and enchantment.

Books mentioned by Nate:
G. K. Chesterton's autobiography
Orthodoxy by G. K. Chesterton
God in the Dock by C. S. Lewis
The Secret History of Christianity by Mark Vernon
Saving the Appearances by Owen Barfield
Dominion by Tom Holland
